page.title: 09Chew Stoke "Harvest Home"
page.content: Whereas in the old days "Harvest Home" was celebrated at individual farms, in 1985 it has become a village affair run by a committee to raise funds for various causes and local activities. Started about 60 years ago, Chew Stoke Harvest Home has become a Flower, {Fruit and Vegetable Show}with various competitions including{painting}and {photography,}well-supported and becoming more popular. The{horse show} and{gymkhana}attracts many entries, the{dog show}is popular and although the fairground no longer operates, there are plenty of amusements fot the children. Like all outdoor activities it does depend on the weather for a good fund raising result but even when the tents collapse all is not lost - the show goes on, in the village hall - disaster, as usual, bringing out the best in the community.
